name: src/dynamic-css-animation.js
DynamicCssAnimation
description: A helper class for building CSS animations from code

name: constructor
description: Initializes a new animation.

name: name
description:
Gets the name of the animation.

The name is the CSS class to use with {@link CssAnimationEvent} or to manually
apply to an element if not using {@link Timeline}.

name: addKeyFrame
description: Adds a new keyframe to the animation.

params.name: duration
params.description: The amount of time (in seconds) to animate to this frame.

params.name: style
params.description: An object representing CSS style attributes and their values.

name: generateStyle
description:
Generates the CSS style and appends it to the document head.

Generally you should call this method before using the animation so the browser
has the CSS. Alternatively you can use {@link createCssString} to create the
CSS and then insert it into the document yourself.

If you use this method for an animation you don't plan to re-use, you should at
some point call {@link destroyStyle} to remove the generated style block from
the document.

name: destroyStyle
description: Removes the style block inserted by {@link generateStyle}.

name: createCssString
description:
Creates the CSS for this animation.

This method is used internally by {@link generateStyle}, which is the recommended
method to use when using this class for animations. However if you would rather
manage inserting the CSS into the document you can call this method to simply
get the CSS as a string.

name: src/events/callback-event.js
CallbackEvent
description: An event that invokes a function when started

name: constructor
description: Initializes the event.

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to invoke when the event starts.

name: src/events/concurrent-event.js
ConcurrentEvent
description:
An event that concurrently starts any number of children.

This event is used to have simultaneous animations or timelines. All
children of the event are started when the event are started, and the
event doesn't complete until all children have completed.

name: constructor
description: Initializes the event.

name: src/events/css-animation-event.js
CssAnimationEvent
description: An event that applies a CSS animation to an element.

name: constructor
description: Initializes the event.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to apply the animation to.

params.name: className
params.description: A CSS class that has an `animation` property on it.

name: src/events/delay-event.js
DelayEvent
description: An event that simply delays a {@link Timeline} from continuing

name: constructor
description: Initializes the event.

params.name: time
params.description: The time to delay, in seconds.

name: src/events/set-style-event.js
SetStyleEvent
description: An event that sets style properties on an element.

name: constructor
description: Initializes the event.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to apply the style to.

params.name: style
params.description: An object representing the style keys and values to apply to the element.

name: src/events/timeline-event.js
TimelineEvent
description: An event that runs a {@link Timeline}.

name: constructor
description: Initializes the event.

name: src/index.js
content:
export { Timeline } from './timeline'

export { CallbackEvent } from './events/callback-event'
export { ConcurrentEvent } from './events/concurrent-event'
export { CssAnimationEvent } from './events/css-animation-event'
export { DelayEvent } from './events/delay-event'
export { SetStyleEvent } from './events/set-style-event'
export { TimelineEvent } from './events/timeline-event'

export { DynamicCssAnimation } from './dynamic-css-animation'

name: src/timeline.js
Timeline
description:
Coordinating object that holds a list of events that are
played sequentially to create animations.

name: constructor
description: Initializes a new Timeline.

name: add
description:
Adds an event to the timeline.

An event is any object that implements a basic interface consisting
of `start` and `stop` methods. `start` is called with a completion
callback function that the event must call when completion is reached.
`stop` should stop any asynchronous work for the event and should **not**
invoke the complete method passed into `start`.

params.name: event
params.description: The event to add to the timeline

return.description: The timeline, to support call chaining.

name: addCallback
description:
Constructs a {@link CallbackEvent} to the timeline, forwarding all arguments,
and adds it to the timeline.

return.description: The timeline, to support call chaining.

name: addConcurrent
description:
Constructs a {@link ConcurrentEvent} to the timeline, forwarding all arguments,
and adds it to the timeline.

return.description: The timeline, to support call chaining.

name: addCssAnimation
description:
Constructs a {@link CssAnimationEvent} to the timeline, forwarding all arguments,
and adds it to the timeline.

return.description: The timeline, to support call chaining.

name: addDelay
description:
Constructs a {@link DelayEvent} to the timeline, forwarding all arguments,
and adds it to the timeline.

return.description: The timeline, to support call chaining.

name: addSetStyle
description:
Constructs a {@link SetStyleEvent} to the timeline, forwarding all arguments,
and adds it to the timeline.

return.description: The timeline, to support call chaining.

name: addTimeline
description:
Constructs a {@link TimelineEvent} to the timeline, forwarding all arguments,
and adds it to the timeline.

return.description: The timeline, to support call chaining.

name: branch
description:
Creates a number of timelines, passes them to the function provided,
and wraps them all in a {@link ConcurrentEvent}.

The function passed in must have a defined `.length`. That length is used to
know how many new timelines to create. This mainly means your function
should not use rest parameters.

params.name: fn
params.description: A function called that is expected to configure the newly created timelines.

return.description: The timeline, to support call chaining.

name: start
description: Starts playing the timeline.

params.name: options.iterations
params.description: The number of times to play through the events. Defaults to 1.

params.name: options.onComplete
params.description:
A function to invoke when the timeline finishes playing.
This will never be invoked if iterations is set to `Infinity`.

name: stop
description:
Stops the timeline, if it is playing.

Aside from preventing starting any new events, this also calls `stop`
on the current event to allow it to clean up.

content:
# Seashell 🐚

A lovely library for web animations.

Checkout the [examples](https://nickgravelyn.github.io/seashell) to get an idea of what the library can do.

## Get Started

```
yarn add seashell-animation
```

or

```
npm add --save seashell-animation
```

Then you can import and use the library:

```js
import { Timeline } from 'seashell-animation'

let timeline = new Timeline()
// etc
```

package.json
